reviews.content: Great location, near to shops, restaurants and local train/DLR services  Room was clean, bed was comfortable and shower was good.

reviews.title: As good as ever
reviews.content: We often stay at the Greenwich IBIS. Friendly helpful staff, comfortable bed, reasonable pricing for London. We had a disabled room - safe wet room and plenty of grab rails. Main room has weird decor (several shades of grey plus a bit of literally bloody red) - not to our taste but you spend most of your time in a bedroom with your eyes closed....

reviews.title: great location - comfortable stay
reviews.content: stayed for a one night trip to a concert on the Cutty Sark. ideal spot only a few minutes walk from the venue, right across the road from Greenwich Market, 5 mins from the railway station and easy access for plenty of restaurants. Comfortable room  and friendly greeting.

reviews.title: Great no frills room
reviews.content: Great location for park, Naval College, National maritime Museum, Observatory, Cutty Sark and markets. Informal check-in, small but spotlessly clean room with comfortable bed. TV, hairdryer and kettle all working. Shower room very small and could have done with an extra towel or two, but for the money I couldn't fault it, really.

reviews.title: Great for marathon , poor for air con !
reviews.content: Stayed here with my wife when I was running the marathon .  Fantastic location with only 10 - 15 minute walk to start area.  Good location for surrounding shops , Restauraunt‚Äôs etc although a struggle to get pasta close by ( only 1 x Restauraunt that sold pasta !!lol)  The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful  Room was small but clean  Shower was great and bed extremely comfortable .  The one thing that lets this hotel down is the lack of air conditioning .  In fairness to the staff , when we highlighted it , they said it was ‚Äú climate control‚Äù but they couldn‚Äôt do much .  The hotel management need to rectify this as having to sleep on top of the covers with the window open in this day is unacceptable .

reviews.title: Place for a qucik stay
reviews.content: I was there for two nights as I had a seminar at the Greenwich University which is located in front of the Hotel. The reception was very minimalistic but quick and gentle.  The room had no wardrobes, beds were average but the bathroom was very large. I'd had preferred more towels thought. Everything went smooth.

reviews.title: Perfect location for London Marathon, but that's it, otherwise stay clear
reviews.content: I could write pages on this hotel but I really can‚Äôt be bothered, it is quite easily summed up.  ¬£298 for 2 nights - the night before the London Marathon and the night after - is a joke.  I appreciate everywhere in London probably flexes prices based on demand marathon weekend, especially Greenwich, but please at least pretend you‚Äôre not fleecing us senseless and attempt to offer some semblance of customer service. Room was pokey with no bath, though never claimed a bath in fairness.  Room, and hotel in general however were baking hot, and have been on all 3 stays.  Air-con in the rooms was totally useless, and opening the window just invited in a load of chatter and shouting from a service yard directly below.

reviews.title: Nice location
reviews.content: Nice clean room with good bed. Neat bathroom set up. Since we're getting older having the elevator was good as well as the restaurant attached. Hotel staff very helpful and up on all the latest technology. Location great to get to all the sites in Greenwich, Canary wharf or catch the Underground to London proper. Staying out in Greenwich is a reminder of what London was like in the 80's. Sure wish they had one more chair in the room. Certainly will consider when we go back in September.

reviews.title: poor hospitality
reviews.content: This hotel has apparently decided that hospitality, service and class are concepts that do not appeal to the modern traveler. The reception desk is gone. Instead, staff in T-shirts hang around in the entrance area and use their phones to check you in. In general, they were kind and helpful, but it didn't work for me. For one thing, the situation is confusing. But more seriously, it plays down the fundamental distribution of the roles we play in the hotel business, namely that we pay for service. To receive the guests at a desk acknowledges that there is an asymmetry here, and hobnobbing with teenagers in T-shirts on a welcome mat may be fun, but it does not signal a particular awareness that the hotel takes its specific role in this transaction seriously.

reviews.title: A Good Choice
reviews.content: Lived-up to my usual good experience of Ibis hotels. Good quality no frills accommodation. Well located both for Greenwich and easy access to central London via DLR. Liked having breakfast in the associated Cafe Rouge next door. Will not hesitate to return.

reviews.title: Early check in
reviews.content: Needed an early check in so I phoned this hotel whose website said for an extra ¬£10 they can guarantee an early check in from 9am and the woman on the phone said the hotel cannot guarantee an early check in and I may have to wait until a room becomes available. They wanted me to pay before they could give me an answer. I don't think so. Accor hotels by the way if ur thinking about booking online. Idiots.

reviews.title: Great place
reviews.content: Had to go to London on a short notice. Really good location and excellent reception service. Straight from the entrance you are welcomed by a warm smile of the reception team.

reviews.title: Great value London by the Thames
reviews.content: We stayed here for one night as it was very convenient for Greenwich, The Curry Sark, The Royal Navel Collage, The Royal Observatory It‚Äôs on the Thames and across the road from the Great Greenwich Market which is filled with lots of interesting stalls selling fabulous gifts and tasteful souvenirs of London.  Greenwich itself has an array of little boutiques and eating places and the lovely Greenwich Park. If you walk to the top there is an amazing view of the whole of London and the Thames snaking it‚Äôs way through the town. Highly recommended for everyone tourists and locals. Along the Thames itself there are some lovely Restaurants and pubs selling great food. The Ibis itself was lovely and clean the staff very helpful and friendly and the beds really comfortable.

reviews.title: Ibis Hotel Greenwich
reviews.content: No fuss, online booking and check in. Clean cheap room for an overnight stay, bar still open for a night cap when we arrived back from the theatre. Car parking very reasonable with extension available at a good price too. Choices of transport into the city from local pier or bus stops also reasonably priced, quick and easy with contactless payment on board. All staff polite and helpful, thankyou we‚Äôll be back.

reviews.title: Hotel break in Greenwich London.
reviews.content: Very welcoming hotel,very pleasant and helpful staff,hotel was clean,room was well stocked and clean,breakfast is next door at Cafe Rouge but the entrance is inside the hotel,again here breakfast was fine and staff again were excellent. If you want to stay in Greenwich I would recommend this hotel,it is in the centre not to far from the Cutty Sark,DLR is close by with a range of pubs and restaurants to eat it is ideal.

reviews.title: Paul ennis
reviews.content: Ideal location for greenwich.

reviews.title: Good
reviews.content: Once again a good stay at this hotel. Most rooms are now upgraded to the new style. Friendly efficient staff. Saw a few people having difficulty, however, all of their own making.  Very good rate for parking (¬£15 a day). Right on the doorstep of London. 2 mins from the river bus and straight in to London.

reviews.title: Good ,Clean Hotel in great location
reviews.content: Our stay in this Hotel was to enable us to attend a nearby family funeral. Our request for a quiet room upper floor was granted with no problem. The room was standard Ibis type as was the bathroom - clean and efficient. I will say the towels were quite thin but did the job. Tea/coffee facilities and an ironing board/iron were provided. Breakfast was not the normal Ibis type - it was in the adjoining restaurant and although 'okay' if you wanted a cooked breakfast there wasn't the usual choice and just 1 hot drink in the price of ¬£9.95. Car parking is ¬£15 per night - remember to tell them at check in or you could receive a fine. Just a stones throw from the Thames path, Cutty Sark and Royal Naval College with plenty coffee/eating places around ( see separate reviews ).

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in a very central location
reviews.content: Good clean economic hotel with cafe rouge next door for food. Will return to do more sightseeing in great location. Stayed 2 enjoyable nights. Shame dustmen empties bins around 4am but I suppose it needs to be done.

reviews.title: Basic but decent
reviews.content: Good basic hotel.  Room was of a decent size & clean enough.  No problems with any of the hotel staff ‚Äì they all seemed to be polite & helpful.  The no desk check- in is one that I actually prefer as providing you check-in online, you can be in your room in a minute. Check-out was even faster, just drop your card off on the way out.  I had no problems with any sound issues & slept very well, although I did ask for a quiet room when booking.  I would have preferred a buffet breakfast as the choices on offer seemed to be on the small side for the price you pay (¬£10), whereas with a buffet you can eat as much as you want.  The hotel was easy enough to find, approx. 2 minutes‚Äô walk from the Greenwich DLR station.

reviews.title: Worse than before..
reviews.content: Selections of problems included:  Was easier to check in with a desk  The new bathroom design means you can‚Äôt sit on the loo (if you have legs)  Staff are particularly brusque and were really rude to my colleague because he had misunderstood some English - neither party were native English speakers.   Removal of car park barrier means you have to tell them you have parked or risk a fine. Although that‚Äôs not really clear. Have a damn barrier - you‚Äôre charging a fortune for parking!  The full English breakfast in the adjoining restaurant is not full. It‚Äôs about half a breakfast - the baked beans are served in  a pot about the size of a thimble. Toast is an extra ¬£1:50.  Some rooms have doors connecting rooms which aren‚Äôt acoustically sound.

reviews.title: Good location and price, basic rooms
reviews.content: You get what you pay for! Rates here are extremely competitive and offer excellent value for money, but if it's home comforts you're after this isn't the hotel for you!   My understanding is that all rooms in this type of Ibis are the same. They are perfectly functional, our room was spacious and clean. We asked for a twin room, beds are very narrow but extremely comfy. It lacked amenities but you do get a wall mounted shower  gel and hand wash, also tea and coffee.   The location is great, everything in Greenwich is within 5-10 minutes walk. Staff were polite and reception was warm and welcoming.  Breakfast is served at the adjoining Cafe Rouge and offers excellent value, a good menu choice and friendly service.  All in all I really can't complain.

reviews.title: Poor soundproofing
reviews.content: Choose to Stay here for three nights as I‚Äôve used ibis before and enjoyed my visit. However this ibis was of a different standard and didn‚Äôt provide a buffet breakfast, only access to a cafe Rouge next door for ¬£9.25 each morning. There was several choices but none that catered for someone who doesn‚Äôt like a big breakfast.  The location was great. The room was clean and of an adequate size and the bed comfy but the soundproofing was poor. I was kept awake until after 12 by a telly on the NEXT corridor and woken 6am by it.

reviews.title: Very friendly staff
reviews.content: My partner and I found this hotel very clean throughout and the staff were very helpful. Our room was nice and clean with a nice shower room. All in all, it was a pleasant stay at this hotel. It‚Äôs in an ideal spot of Greenwich London, a quick taxi ride to the 02 Arena and other places of interest. The restaurant next door serves up very nice food at reasonable prices for London.

reviews.title: Location, Location, Location - Excellent !
reviews.content: This Hotel enjoys a fantastic location, adjacent to the ''Greenwich Culture Hub'' - a hive of activity, where a truly cosmopolitan mix, of locals, tourists, students et al, fill the streets with colour and culture.  Shops, boutiques, bistros, restaurants, pubs, cafes and bars all vie for attention, just five minutes walk from superb historic buildings, architecture, historic landmarks, and of course the legendary River Thames, and all year round beautiful Greenwich park.  The Maritime Museum, Cutty Sark, Gypsy Moth ( To name but a few of the stellar attractions ) Are only 5 minutes walk from the Hotel, while the 02 Arena is just 5 minutes ride away by taxi.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, but there always seem to be problems at check in
reviews.content: Nice hotel near the Greenwich Market  Simple rooms but clean and comfortable.  Breakfast in the Caf√© Rouge alongside which is always good  The only complaint is that there always seem to be problems at check-in. This time they insisted for 10 minutes that the room had not been prepaid, and only as I stood my ground did they carry on checking till they found it.

reviews.title: Very good and will stay again.
reviews.content: This was our second stay here and won't be the last, the hotel is very well presented, clean and modern with friendly efficient staff. The location is excellent for Greenwich, for the tourist trails and transport links, more than enough restaurants and bars within minutes walk.

reviews.title: Nice Hotel, good value and location
reviews.content: Got a good rate on the hotel, Arrival to the carpark which wasn't full, even the next morning so I imagine parking is not an issue.  It cost ¬£15 for 24hrs, could have sworn I saw it advertised at ¬£13 however.  Check in the usual quirky way, met at the door by a member of staff and a PDA. All was simple enough.  Got the invoiced emailed to me on check in, which is good. Avoids waiting on it the next morning and easy to drop key cards in box.  Lift was key card operated, my room was on the second floor.  Not much of a view (of some AC equipment).  Room is modern and clean. Medium sized room with a comfy bed.  The bath room is not a bad size, however the toilet is in the corner which left not a lot of room to manoeuvre.  TV with free view, a hair dryer and Tea/coffee available.

reviews.title: Very good but smelly
reviews.content: My husband and I stayed at the Greenwich Ibis this weekend.   The location is fantastic, the room was perfectly adequate.  We walked into the room and there was a dreadful smell, we weren‚Äôt sure what it was at all, but opened the window.  We came back very late at night and the smell was still terrible.  The next morning we mentioned this to the receptionist who offered us to move.   We were on our way out and had a very busy day planned as it was my husbands birthday, so we didn‚Äôt have time to go and pack out things back up.  I just asked if they could have a look and maybe spray some air freshener.   We returned late that night and it was just the same.  I spoke to a lady on our way to check out and she reported the same problem in her room also.

reviews.title: Christmas break away
reviews.content: From booking to checking out, everything about our trip was fab. The hotel had parking which felt secure and it was easy to check in and get to our room. Although basic, our double room had a comfy big bed and tea making facilities. The bathroom was like something you'd expect on a spaceship, but it was just right for what we needed! We didn't make use of the bar/cafe downstairs, but it always seemed busy and had a good atmosphere. The location was ideal and was close to both the DLR and the river taxi, so within minutes you find yourself at all the famous attractions without too much hassle. Greenwich itself is lovely.  Steeped in history and has it's own attractions to see.

reviews.title: Last time?
reviews.content: Coming here since 2007 this Year is Perhaps the last time. December 2016 we failed to come because my dad died just before boarding the plane in Amsterdam. We informed Ibis and they just said ‚Äúyou can‚Äôt cancell‚Äù. Not even Some Words of sympathy, but ok. This time arrived in the Evening and there was no counter, a young girl came upon us, sat down on a high table with a laptop and het I-phone. Just then we realised that was the counter. We checked in and the room was ok. For the next days we noticed a letter in the elevator telling the questions there would be a fire test that day ....... What day, iT still hangs there after 5 days.  Must say that most of the time there is nobody at the lounge for the guests.
